Steps to prepare your finances before investing

sections.title: Why Investing Matters
sections.content: Investing is the engine that helps your money outpace inflation and convert steady contributions into long-term wealth. While saving keeps money safe, investing puts it to work through businesses, governments, or assets that generate profit. The key is matching your goals and time horizon with the right investment approach.

points.title: Risk and Return
points.description: Higher potential returns usually involve higher risk. Align your risk tolerance with the right mix of investments.

points.title: Time in the Market
points.description: Consistent investing over long periods beats attempts to perfectly time entry and exit points.

points.title: Diversification
points.description: Spreading investments across asset types reduces the impact of any single underperformer.

sections.title: The Power of Compounding
sections.content: A $200 monthly contribution earning 7% annually for 25 years grows to more than $163,000—over double the $60,000 you contributed.

sections.title: Pre-Investing Checklist
sections.content: Before you invest, cover emergency savings, pay high-interest debt, and clarify your goals. Decide what each investment is funding—retirement, education, or wealth-building—and determine how long the money can stay invested.

sections.title: Your Next Steps
steps: Write down one long-term goal (5+ years) that investing will support.
Calculate how much of your monthly budget you can dedicate to investing.
List any financial gaps to close before investing (emergency fund, debt, insurance).
Pick a target date to open or review your investment account.
